__e: You know, Ellen is right, and I am through arguing with you.
But, Ellen, are we right in just sitting by?
- Oh, Mom, will you tell her Ellen's my wife?
Ellen and I have a pretty regular life.
Unless, of course, he told Ellen and happened to bypass you.
Ellen and I want to help you give the kids a nice Christmas.
Isn't it funny, Ellen? You can't see the wind and you can't touch it.
Ellen, did you have anything to do with this?
Really, Ellen, there's nothing left to do.
She says her name is Ellen something or other.
Ellen had absolutely nothing to do with this.
Why would he--? - For the reason Ellen's in trouble.
Ellen's over at the hotel, wants to see me.
Ellen will be wanting to see you.
